title: USMS Agreements with Mobile Phone Providers

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) T-Mobile: All active legal contracts, NDAs, agreements, MOUs, SOWs, invoices, and contracting documents between USMS (or equivalent DOJ contracting bodies entering into agreements on behalf of USMS) and T-Mobile
2) Verizon: All active legal contracts, NDAs, agreements, MOUs, SOWs, invoices, and contracting documents between USMS (or equivalent DOJ contracting bodies entering into agreements on behalf of USMS) and Verizon (also known as Verizon Wireless)
3) AT&T: All active legal contracts, NDAs, agreements, MOUs, SOWs, invoices, and contracting documents between USMS (or equivalent DOJ contracting bodies entering into agreements on behalf of USMS) and AT&T

Additionally, for the time period of January 1, 2024 through the date of fulfillment of this request, I am requesting:

4) All emails between USMS personnel and T-Mobile by searching for emails to/from the domain "@t-mobile.com" domain
5) All emails between USMS personnel and Verizon by searching for emails to/from the "@verizonwireless.com" domain
6) All emails between USMS personnel and AT&T by searching for emails to/from the "@att.com" domain

For email messages with attachments, please include the attachments in your response. You may de-duplicate identical emails to reduce the responsive documents if the number of emails are high/burdensome.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A
